subject: Law
title: Clickwrap and Browsewrap Agreements
description: One-minute skill: Clickwrap and Browsewrap Agreements.

hook.text: You clicked 'I agree' without reading 50 pages of terms. You just entered a binding contract.

buildup.text: Clickwrap agreements require users to click a button agreeing to terms. Courts generally enforce them.

discovery.text: Browsewrap agreements say 'by using this site, you agree.' No click neededâ€”and courts are more skeptical.

twist.text: The key issue is notice: did the user have a reasonable opportunity to read the terms before agreeing?

climax.text: Buried terms that are surprising or unconscionable may still be struck down, even in clickwrap agreements.

punchline.text: Clicking 'agree' is the new handshake. Reading the terms is the new diligence.

quiz.question: Why are browsewrap agreements harder to enforce than clickwrap?
options: Users may not have reasonable notice of the terms
